SEARCH
Package org.myshelfie.network.server

Class GameListener

java.lang.Object
org.myshelfie.network.server.GameListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
Listener<GameEvent>
public class GameListener extends Object implements Listener<GameEvent>
Listener responsible for events that are triggered by a change occurring in the model. It refers to events of type GameEvent, which are generated by classes in the model package.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameListener

      public GameListener(Server server, Client client, Game listenedGame)
      This listener is responsible for reacting to changes in the model, thus it's concerned in sending the modelView message via the update() method whenever a change occurs.
      Parameters:
      server - The Server object that will send the message
      client - The Client that is interested in listening a Game
      listenedGame - The game that the client wants to listen to. (In view of implementing multi-game handling)

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(GameEvent ev, Object... args)
      This update method is called from the EventManager.notify() method when a change occurs in the model. Since a single execution of the executeCommand() may trigger many events, this method is implemented to catch and save only the last, to avoid sending multiple messages with small changes to the client. Moreover, the implementation makes use of the isMyGameChanged(org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameEvent, java.lang.Object) method to check if the object that triggered the event belongs to the game that this listener is listening to.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Listener<GameEvent>
      Parameters:
      ev - The event that was fired. NOTE: This must be an element of an enumeration
      args - Contains different number and types of parameters depending on event type

    • sendLastEvent

      public void sendLastEvent()
      Send the last event to the client.

    • isMyGameChanged

      private boolean isMyGameChanged(GameEvent ev, Object changedItem)
      Check if the object that changed belongs to the game that this listener is listening to. Thus, the checks are made on the object that triggered the event, and they depend on the type of event.
      Parameters:
      ev - the event that has been emitted
      changedItem - the object that changed and triggered the event
      Returns:
      true if the object that triggered the event belongs to the game that this listener is listening to.

    • getClient

      public Client getClient()
      Returns:
      The client this listener belongs to
